item.title: Virtual Drag and Drop using hand
item.author: Author
item.description: VirtualDragAndDrop I was kind of bored a week end so I wanted to do something that will be absolutely never used again 🙃. This little project allowed me to get in touch with OpenCV and image processing. The program I built creates a virtual drag and drop on objects represented by their centers. I used rectangle for this example. To use the program, just run the file main.py. Then to move an object, you have to “grab it” = close your hand when your hand is on the object.

item.title: Challenge DATA & AI by Ens'IA and Neovision
item.author: Author
item.description: The challenge: This challenge was organized by Ens’IA and Neovision in 2021. It lasted a month and a half and was about the well known subject of Optical Character Recognition (OCR). What is OCR ? It’s about converting images of typed, handwritten or printed text into machine-encoded text. Learn more ➡️ The goal was quite simple but still very challenging: building the best model to recognize the characters in the dataset given by Neovision.

item.title: Size of Connex Components in unoriented 2D graph | Ensimag's Project
item.author: Author
item.description: The project Considering a set of points $p_i$, $1 \le i \le n$, and a limit distance $s$, we want to know the number a connex component of the given set of points and distance. Two vertices $p_i$ and $p_j$ are linked by an edge if $d(p_i, p_j) \le s$. A connex component is a sub-graph where all the vertices are linked by transitivity. A solution I worked in pair with Hugo on different methods.

item.title: TodoList implementation
item.author: Author
item.description: The project I always wanted to have a todolist on my desktop (I use Gnome). I made few research for widget on the internet, did not find what I was looking for, so I decided to make my own. I wanted something that does not consume too much power, that is easy to use (as fast as possible to add something in a terminal) and free. What I built I have chosen to create a todolist that actually changes the background of my computer, so that the consumption of my todolist is down to 0 when I am not changing anything.
